data.title: Marriages Between Royals
data.meta_description:
The only Royals to-day are King Juan Carlos and  Queen Sophie  of Spain born HRH Princess of Grece, both children of RHH.
The last ones were the Grand-Dukes...
data.text:
The only Royals to-day are King Juan Carlos and Queen Sophie of Spain born HRH Princess of Grece, both children of RHH.

The last ones were the Grand-Dukes Jean and Josephine-Charlotte of Luxembourg, born HRH Princess of Belgium

Queen Elisabeth II's Mother was a nobel women of Scotland, but Prince Philip 's parents were both RHH.

Queen Margareth II is the daughter of both RHH. and her husband is Henri de Montpezat.

Queen Beatrix is the daughter of both RHH and her husband was Claus von Amsberg.

For the Kings of the past we have King Constantin and Queen Anne-Marie of Grece, born HRH Princess of Danemark

King Michel and Queen Anne de Roumanie, born HRH Princess of Bourbon-Parme.

Other Royal- Royal Princes are:

TRHH Maria-Pia of Savoie and Michel de Bourbon-Parme, TRHH Alexandre de Yougoslavie and Barbara von un zu Liechtenstein, TRHH Carl von Habsbourg and Marie-Astrid of Luxembourg, TRHH Hans-Johann von Hohenzollerrn and Birgitta of Sweden, TRHH Duke Karl and Diane of Wurtenberg, born Princess of Orléans.

Do I forgot others ??

and more

It would be much easier to find HRH and HSH or HH mariiages.

HRH Prince George, Duke of Kent and Princess Marina of Greece (1934)

HRH Prince Paul of Serbia and Princess Olga of Greece (1934)

HRH Prince George of Greece and Princess Marie Boneparte (1907)

HRH the Prince of Wales (Edward VII) and HRH Princess Alexandra of Denmark (1863)

Today's royals...

Britain

TRH Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie of York

HRH Princess Louise of Wessex (styled Lady Louise Windsor)

HRH Prince James, Viscount Severn (styled Lord James Windsor)

Belgium

HRH the Duke of Brabant and HRH Duchess of Brabant née Countess Mathilde d'Udekem d'Acoz

Their children are all Royal Highnesses by birth.

HRH Princess Astrid of Belgium and HI&RH Archduke Lorenzo of Austria-Este

Their children are all Imperial and Royal Highnesses

Denmark

Margrethe II is descended from mostly royal highnesses, including her parents.

HRH the Crown Prince Frederick. His wife, Mary Donaldson held no title before their marriage.

Their children Prince Christian and Princess Isabella are both Royal Highnesses by birth.

...most of the royal children of this generation are Royal Highnesses by birth. I don't think I can name them all. lol

Some devorced couple

Eugen Eberhard Duke of Wurttemberg and Alexandra Archduchess of Austria

I think you are wrong as far as George VI being born HH, only when his father became king he put through the rules, who will be HRH and who not, correct me if I am wrong.

TRHH William and Harry

HRH Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer

...

HRH Prince George (born as HH) and Lady Elizabeth

...

HM Carl XVI Gustav and Silvia

These marriages are not between royal houses. (I'm not sure why you mention Princes William and Harry at all, since at the time of your post neither one was married, and Prince William has since married a commoner):

- Lady Diana Spencer was not a royal highness before (or after) her marriage to Prince Charles.

- Prince Albert (who later reigned as George VI) was born a prince of a royal house but married someone who was not of royal birth but rather the daughter of a Scottish Earl. In fact, the Queen Mother (as she was later known) had many had many commoners in her lineage.

- The current Queen of Sweden was born Silvia Sommerlath and most definitely a commoner.

Marie-Christine von H-L and almost Count Rodolphe de Limburg-Stirum

I'm not sure what you mean by "almost Count," but in any event Count Rodolphe de Limburg-Stirum is not a member of a royal house and does not bear the title of royal (or any other) highness. So theirs is not a marriage between two royal houses either.
